Show HN: OpenBracket, a collaborative code editor for technical interviews
text:
Hi everyone!

At Fluxon, we found that we were't happy with existing solutions for collaborative coding with engineering candidates in our technical interviews. So we built OpenBracket.net—a simple code editor with no setup or log in needed—just share the link and start coding together.

Our first version is now available for anyone to use. We’d love some feedback. Thanks!

Ask HN: Lifting a Google Ads Account Suspension/ How?
text: I set up a new google ads account. Entered all the information, rewrote the ad copy they suggested. Specified my audience, budget and entered my credit card details - a credit card I use to pay my Google Workspace account for three seperate businesses. I am on the home-straight, ready for Google to work its magic and generate my business some leads, or so i thought. I hit submit, the final step in the process, only to be told on the next screen that my account is suspended due to suspicious payment activity associated with my account. This a new account so I am confused. I submit an appeal only to be told  that my ads are in violation of Google's policies - they aren't. Any advice from the HN crowd on how to resolve this Kafka-esque situation?
